intro: Rhododendron haematophthalmum, commonly known as the blood-eyed rhododendron, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern China. It is characterized by its dark red to purple flowers, which are adorned with distinctive red markings resembling eyes, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the Ericaceae family and is known for its evergreen foliage, which remains lush throughout the growing season. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires a cool, moist climate to flourish. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens and botanical collections.
